018package org.tquadrat.foundation.lang;
019
020import static java.lang.System.getProperty;
021import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.DEPRECATED;
022import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
023
024import java.io.File;
025import java.lang.reflect.Field;
026import java.lang.reflect.Method;
027import java.math.BigDecimal;
028import java.net.InetAddress;
029import java.net.URI;
030import java.net.URL;
031import java.nio.charset.Charset;
032import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
033import java.text.DecimalFormat;
034import java.text.NumberFormat;
035import java.time.Instant;
036import java.time.ZoneId;
037import java.util.Date;
038import java.util.List;
039import java.util.Locale;
040import java.util.Map;
041import java.util.PropertyResourceBundle;
042import java.util.TimeZone;
043import java.util.UUID;
044import java.util.function.Predicate;
045import java.util.regex.Pattern;
046
047import org.apiguardian.api.API;
048import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
049import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.UtilityClass;
050import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError;
051
052/**
053 *  <p>{@summary This class provides a bunch of commonly used constants.}</p>
054 *  <p>The constants are arranged into several categories.</p>
055 *  <ul>
056 *      <li>{@code EMPTY_*_ARRAY} constants: These constants are most useful in
057 *      the context of the
058 *      {@link java.util.Collection#toArray(Object[]) toArray()} methods of the
059 *      various collection implementations.</li>
060 *      <li>Physical constants like gravity and speed of light.</li>
061 *      <li>XML constants, like often used names for entities and
062 *      attributes.</li>
063 *      <li>Miscellaneous constants like the empty string or the null
064 *      char.</li>
065 *  </ul>
066 *
067 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
068 *  @version $Id: CommonConstants.java 885 2021-03-23 19:33:53Z tquadrat $
069 *  @since 0.0.5
070 *
071 *  @UMLGraph.link
072 */
073@SuppressWarnings( "ClassWithTooManyFields" )
074@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: CommonConstants.java 885 2021-03-23 19:33:53Z tquadrat $" )
075@UtilityClass
076public final class CommonConstants
077{
078        /*-----------*\
079    ====** Constants **========================================================
080        \*-----------*/
081    //---* Some character constants *------------------------------------------
082    /**
083     *  The horizontal ellipsis: &hellip;
084     *  (&amp;hellip;/&amp;#8230;/&amp;#x2026;/\u2026).
085     */
086    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
087    public static final char CHAR_ELLIPSIS = '\u2026';
088
089    /**
090     *  The hyphen character (&amp;#8208;/&amp;#x2010;/\u2010/HYPHEN).<br>
091     *  <br>This is different from the character '&#x002D;' (HYPHEN-MINUS),
092     *  although it looks similar. This character can be used as a replacement
093     *  for the HYPHEN-MINUS in contexts where HYPHEN-MINUS has a special
094     *  meaning.
095     */
096    /*
097     * For some reason, JavaDoc refuses to accept both &#8208; and &#x2010;
098     * as valid entities.
099     */
100    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
101    public static final char CHAR_HYPHEN = '\u2010';
102
103    /**
104     *  The non-breaking space character (&amp;#x00A0;/\u00A0).
105     */
106    @SuppressWarnings( "SpellCheckingInspection" )
107    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
108    public static final char CHAR_NBSP = '\u00A0';
109
110    /**
111     *  The  small non-breaking space character (&amp;#x202F;/\u202F).
112     */
113    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
114    public static final char CHAR_NNBSP = '\u202F';
115
116    /**
117     *  The zero-width non-breaking space character; in fact, the 'word joiner'
118     *  character that should be used instead of the original character.
119     */
120    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
121    public static final char CHAR_ZWNBSP = '\u2060';
122
123    //---* Empty Array Constants *---------------------------------------------
124    /**
125     *  An empty array of {@code boolean}s.
126     *
127     *  @deprecated The empty arrays were created to optimize the use of the
128     *      method {@code toArray(Object[])} of the collection types. This got
129     *      obsolete when Java&nbsp;11 introduced the method
130     *      {@code toArray(IntFunction)}; the {@code IntFunction} could be the
131     *      call to {@code new []}.
132     */
133    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
134    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
135    public static final boolean [] EMPTY_boolean_ARRAY =  new boolean [0];
136
137    /**
138     *  An empty array of

144     *      obsolete when Java&nbsp;11 introduced the method

577    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
578    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
579    public static final short [] EMPTY_short_ARRAY = new short [0];
580
581    /**
582     *  An empty array of
583     *  {@link Short}
584     *  objects.
585     *
586     *  @deprecated The empty arrays were created to optimize the use of the
587     *      method {@code toArray(Object[])} of the collection types. This got
588     *      obsolete when Java&nbsp;11 introduced the method
589     *      {@code toArray(IntFunction)}; the {@code IntFunction} could be the
590     *      call to {@code new []}.
591     */
592    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0", forRemoval = true )
593    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )

679    //---* Numerical constants that are not in Math *--------------------------
680    /**
681     *  The Gravity constant: 6.672E-11&nbsp;(N&nbsp;*&nbsp;m^2)/(kg^2). An
682     *  alternative unit for the constant is (m^3)/(kg&nbsp;*&nbsp;s^2).
683     */
684    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
685    public static final BigDecimal GRAVITY_CONSTANT = new BigDecimal( "6.672E-11" );
686
687    /**
688     *  The speed of light in km per second = 299792.458&nbsp;km/s.
689     */
690    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
691    public static final BigDecimal SPEED_OF_LIGHT =  new BigDecimal( "299792.458" );
692
693    /**
694     *  The value for 1 G: 9.80665&nbsp;m/(s^2)
695     */
696    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
697    public static final BigDecimal STANDARD_G =  new BigDecimal( "9.80665" );
698
699    /**
700     *  <p>{@summary The time between 1582-10-15T00:00 (the start of the
701     *  Gregorian calendar) and 1970-01-01T00:00 (the beginning of the "Epoch")
702     *  in seconds: {@value}.}</p>
703     *  <p>This constant is used for example to determine the number of
704     *  nanoseconds since the beginning of the Gregorian calendar, and that is
705     *  used to create UUIDs based on time and location.</p>
706     *
707     *  @see java.util.UUID
708     */
709    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
710    public static final long TIME_DELTA_BEGINGREGORIAN2BEGINEPOCH = 12219292800L;
711
712    /**
713     *  The length of a (tropical) year in days, according to SI:
714     *  365.242190517&nbsp;d.
715     */
716    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
717    public static final BigDecimal TROPICAL_YEAR =  new BigDecimal( "365.242190517" );

894    /**
895     *  The system property for the location of the system preferences files on
896     *  a UNIX/Linux system: {@value}.<br>
897     *  <br>If not set, the location is {@code /etc/}, resulting to
898     *  {@code /etc/.java/.systemPrefs}.<br>
899     *  <br>If the default location is used, the respective folder has to be
900     *  created by a user with {@code root} permissions; the files in there
901     *  should have the rights 544, while the folder and its sub-folders should
902     *  have 755.
903     */
904    @SuppressWarnings( "SpellCheckingInspection" )
905    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.6" )
906    public static final String PROPERTY_PREFS_ROOT_SYSTEM = "java.util.prefs.systemRoot";
907
908    /**
909     *  The system property for the location of the user preferences files on
910     *  a UNIX/Linux system: {@value}.<br>
911     *  <br>If not set, the location is {@code ~/}, resulting to
912     *  {@code ~/.java/.userPrefs/}.
913     */
914    @SuppressWarnings( "SpellCheckingInspection" )
915    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.6" )
916    public static final String PROPERTY_PREFS_ROOT_USER = "java.util.prefs.userRoot";
917
918    /**
919     *  The system property for the synchronisation interval of the preferences
920     *  on a UNIX/Linux system, in seconds: {@value}.<br>
921     *  <br>If not set, the interval is 30 seconds. The minimum value is one
922     *  second.
923     */
924    @SuppressWarnings( "SpellCheckingInspection" )
925    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.6" )
926    public static final String PROPERTY_PREFS_SYNC = "java.util.prefs.syncInterval";
927
928    /**

1070    //---* The names of some system thread groups *----------------------------
1071    /**
1072     *  The name of the main thread group: {@value}.<br>
1073     *  <br>This is the group of the main thread.
1074     */
1075    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.6" )
1076    public static final String THREADGROUP_MAIN = "main";
1077
1078    /**
1079     *  The name of the system thread group: {@value}.<br>
1080     *  <br>This is the group of several system threads and the parent thread
1081     *  group for the main thread group.
1082     */
1083    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.6" )
1084    public static final String THREADGROUP_SYSTEM = "system";

1086    //---* Often used XML Element and Attribute names *------------------------
1087    /**
1088     *  The attribute name for an XML attribute holding a category of something:
1089     *  {@value}.
1090     *
1091     *  @see #XMLATTRIBUTE_Type
1092     */
1093    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1094    public static final String XMLATTRIBUTE_Category = "category";
1095
1096    /**
1097     *  The attribute name for an XML attribute holding a class name: {@value}.
1098     *
1099     *  @see #XMLATTRIBUTE_Type
1100     */
1101    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1102    public static final String XMLATTRIBUTE_Class = "class";
1103
1104    /**
1105     *  The attribute name for an XML attribute holding a date, usually without
1106     *  the time information: {@value}.
1107     *
1108     *  @see #XMLATTRIBUTE_Time
1109     *  @see #XMLATTRIBUTE_Timestamp
1110     */
1111    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1112    public static final String XMLATTRIBUTE_Date = "date";
1113
1114    /**
1115     *  The attribute name for an XML attribute holding a file name: {@value}.
1116     */
1117    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1118    public static final String XMLATTRIBUTE_File = "file";
1119
1120    /**
1121     *  The attribute name for the XML id attribute: {@value}.
1122     */
1123    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1124    public static final String XMLATTRIBUTE_Id = "xml:id";
1125
1126    /**
1127     *  The attribute name for the XML idref attribute: {@value}.
1128     */
1129    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1130    public static final String XMLATTRIBUTE_IdRef = "idref";
1131
1132    /**
1133     *  <p>{@summary The attribute name for the XML language attribute:
1134     *  {@value}.}</p>
1135     *  <p>This reserved attribute takes an ISO639 language identifier as
1136     *  value. It indicates the language of the body of the element.</p>
1137     */
1138    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
1139    public static final String XMLATTRIBUTE_Language = "xml:lang";
1140
1141    /**
1142     *  The attribute name for the XML name attribute: {@value}.<br>
1143     *  <br>Only names that follow exact rules for their character set can be
1144     *  stored in XML attributes, but free names have to be stored as XML
1145     *  elements.
1146     *
1147     *  @see #XMLELEMENT_Name
1148     */
1149    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1150    public static final String XMLATTRIBUTE_Name = "name";
1151
1152    /**
1153     *  The name for the node id XML attribute: {@value}.
1154     */
1155    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1156    public static final String XMLATTRIBUTE_NodeId = "node";
1157
1158    /**
1159     *  The name for the PID XML attribute: {@value}.
1160     */
1161    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1162    public static final String XMLATTRIBUTE_PID = "pid";
1163
1164    /**
1165     *  The name for the reference XML attribute: {@value}.
1166     */
1167    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1168    public static final String XMLATTRIBUTE_Reference = "reference";

1173    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )

1175

1177     *  The name for the status XML attribute: {@value}.
1178     */
1179    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1180    public static final String XMLATTRIBUTE_Status = "status";
1181
1182    /**
1183     *  The attribute name for an XML attribute holding a time, usually without
1184     *  the date information: {@value}.
1185     *
1186     *  @see #XMLATTRIBUTE_Date
1187     *  @see #XMLATTRIBUTE_Timestamp
1188     */
1189    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1190    public static final String XMLATTRIBUTE_Time = "time";
1191
1192    /**
1193     *  The name for an XML attribute holding a date/time: {@value}.
1194     *
1195     *  @see #XMLATTRIBUTE_Date
1196     *  @see #XMLATTRIBUTE_Time
1197     */
1198    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1199    public static final String XMLATTRIBUTE_Timestamp = "timestamp";
1200
1201    /**
1202     *  The name for an XML attribute holding a type, in the sense of a
1203     *  <i>category</i> or <i>model</i>, and <i>usually</i> not in the sense
1204     *  this term is used in the context of programming languages: {@value}.
1205     *
1206     *  @see #XMLATTRIBUTE_Category
1207     *  @see #XMLATTRIBUTE_Class
1208     */
1209    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1210    public static final String XMLATTRIBUTE_Type = "type";

1212    /**

1214     */
1215    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1216    public static final String XMLATTRIBUTE_UserId = "userId";
1217
1218    /**
1219     *  The name for the version XML attribute: {@value}.
1220     */
1221    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1222    public static final String XMLATTRIBUTE_Version = "version";
1223
1224    /**
1225     *  <p>{@summary The attribute name for the XML space attribute:
1226     *  {@value}.}</p>
1227     *  <p>This reserved attribute indicates whether any whitespace inside the
1228     *  element is significant and should not be altered by the XML processor.
1229     *  The attribute can take one of two enumerated values:</p>
1230     *  <dl>
1231     *      <dt>{@code preserve}</dt>
1232     *          <dd>The XML application preserves all whitespace (newlines,
1233     *          spaces, and tabs) present within the element.</dd>
1234     *      <dt>{@code default}</dt>
1235     *          <dd>The XML processor uses its default processing rules when
1236     *          deciding to preserve or discard the whitespace inside the
1237     *          element.</dd>
1238     *  </dl>
1239     */
1240    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
1241    public static final String XMLATTRIBUTE_Whitespace = "xml:space";
1242
1243    /**
1244     *  The element name for an XML element representing a comment:
1245     *  {@value}.<br>
1246     *  <br>This is not an XML comment (they will be written as
1247     *  <code>&lt;!--&nbsp;&hellip;&nbsp;--&gt;</code> in the XML stream) but
1248     *  data that is semantically a <i>comment</i> (like a {@code description},
1249     *  see
1250     *  {@linkplain #XMLELEMENT_Description below}).
1251     */
1252    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1253    public static final String XMLELEMENT_Comment = "comment";
1254
1255    /**
1256     *  The element name for an XML element holding a date, usually without
1257     *  the time information: {@value}.

1267     *  kind: {@value}.

1277
1278    /**

1280     *  kind: {@value}.<br>
1281     *  <br>Only names that follow exact rules for their character set can be
1282     *  stored in XML attributes, but free names have to be stored as XML
1283     *  elements.
1284     *
1285     *  @see #XMLATTRIBUTE_Name
1286     */
1287    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )

1317     *  The line terminator as defined by the underlying operating system.
1318     */
1319    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1320    public static final String CR;
1321
1322    /**
1323     *  The decimal separator for the current locale.
1324     */
1325    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1326    public static final char DECIMAL_SEPARATOR;
1327
1328    /**
1329     *  The default application id if nothing else could be used: {@value}.
1330     */
1331    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1332    public static final String DEFAULT_APPLICATION_ID = "Default Program Main";
1333

1335     *  The empty string.

1337    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1338    public static final String EMPTY_STRING;

1341     *  An empty char sequence.
1342     */
1343    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1344    public static final CharSequence EMPTY_CHARSEQUENCE;
1345

1347     *  The End-Of-File marker for streams: {@value}.
1348     */
1349    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1350    public static final int EOF = -1;
1351
1352    /**
1353     *  The index value indicating that nothing was found: {@value}. See for
1354     *  example
1355     *  {@link String#indexOf(int)}.
1356     */
1357    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
1358    public static final int NOT_FOUND = -1;
1359

1362     */

1364    public static final char NULL_CHAR;
1365
1366    /**
1367     *  A String containing the sequence &quot;null&quot;.
1368     */
1369    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1370    public static final String NULL_STRING;
1371
1372    /**
1373     *  The grouping separator for the current locale, used with large numbers
1374     *  to separate thousands.
1375     */
1376    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1377    public static final char THOUSANDS_SEPARATOR;
1378
1379    /**
1380     *  A String containing the sequence {@value}.
1381     */
1382    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1383    public static final String UNKNOWN_STRING = "<UNKNOWN>";
1384
1385    //---* Lambdas *-----------------------------------------------------------
1386    /**
1387     *  Returns {@code true} if the provided reference is {@code null}
1388     *  otherwise returns {@code false}.
1389     *
1390     *  @see Objects#isNull(Object)
1391     *  @see Predicate
1392     */
1393    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1394    public static final Predicate<? extends Object> IS_NULL = Objects::isNull;
1395
1396    /**
1397     *  Returns {@code true} if the provided reference is non-{@code null}
1398     *  otherwise returns {@code false}.
1399     *
1400     *  @see Objects#nonNull(Object)
1401     *  @see Predicate
1402     */
1403    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1404    public static final Predicate<? extends Object> NON_NULL = Objects::nonNull;
1405
1406    //---* Initialise ... *----------------------------------------------------
1407    static
1408    {
1409        CR = getProperty( PROPERTY_LINE_SEPARATOR );
1410
1411        final var format = (DecimalFormat) NumberFormat.getInstance();
1412        final var symbols = format.getDecimalFormatSymbols();
1413        DECIMAL_SEPARATOR = symbols.getDecimalSeparator();
1414        THOUSANDS_SEPARATOR = symbols.getGroupingSeparator();
1415
1416        EMPTY_STRING = "";
1417        EMPTY_CHARSEQUENCE = EMPTY_STRING;
1418        NULL_CHAR = '\u0000';
1419
1420        /*
1421         * The cast is required because if omitted, String.valueOf( char [] ) would
1422         * be called. This in turn would cause an unwanted NullPointerException.
1423         */
1424        NULL_STRING = String.valueOf( (Object) null ).intern();
1425
1426        UTC = TimeZone.getTimeZone( ZONE_UTC );
1427    }
1428
1429        /*--------------*\
1430    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
1431        \*--------------*/
1432    /**
1433     *  No instance of this class is allowed.
1434     */
1435    private CommonConstants() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( CommonConstants.class ); }
1436}
